WorkItem.ClosedComment: Could you provide a code sample that clearly exhibits the issue you're seeing? Refactor -> Rename was known to not work correctly in 0.9.0-alpha and there certainly may still be issues. If you can provide a concise repro that would be helpful.
WorkItem.Description:
Although this issue was somwhere a half year ago, this situation has not been changed.
For example, i rename in refactoring (i'm using VS 2012 and typescript version 0.8.3.1)
one property (in ES5 mode). Property is renamed, but all the uses of the property reference to the old property name.

Expected:
To rename all uses of that property, too. Like it is done in the case of renaming the fields and other class members.
WorkItem.Summary: Renaming property using refactory does not rename all references to the property
